title: youtube embedded video doesn't display thumbnail or "play video" box
content: I have changed settings to "html only" for outgoing messages, and i've taken down my security settings, and i've selected the "add link previews when pasting URL's" setting. however, i still can't see the normal thumbnail or the youtube "play video" box when i embed a youtube video link. any assistance would be greatly appreciated! thank you!

title: Thunderbird auto opens Firebird
content: I just ran a couple updates and now every time I open Thunderbird, Firebird opens also. On the ad screen to donate. This never happened until now. It is annoying since it opens over Thunderbird. How do I get it to stop? I do use it as my default browser, but when I want it. Thanks.
creator: mejacobie1

title: Use of last profile with downgraded Thunderbird (131.0->128.3)
content:
How can I implement my previous profile in 128.3.0 after inadvertent (release channel) automatic update to 131.0 followed by downgrade (uninstall/download/reinstall from thunderbird.net) to latest supported esr release, as recommended.

My last profile worked fine after auto update to 131.0 with emails, local folders, calendar, rules, contacts, etc. all available. Now, when attempting to launch or use that previous profile in reinstalled 128.3 popup advises: "You have launched an older version of Thunderbird." "A newer version of Thunderbird may have made changes to your profile which are no longer compatible with this older version. Use this profile only with that newer version or create a new profile."

Only options then available are "Exit" or "Create New Profile." TB 128.3 will recognize only a newly created generic profile, but not allow previous profile to be launched or set as default from Profile Manager.

Essentially, the options are: 1) Use your previous profile, but only with the Beta 131 release 2) Use the latest supported (128.3) release but only with a newly created profile, not yours.

I've seen this problem posted in several forms by people unknowingly on the "release" update channel who got the 131 release and can't implement their profile after downgrading to the esr release. The recommendations I've found to address this problem seem to lead one to a circular return to the problem.

John C
creator: curtiss3

title: How to install new Thunderbird mail data to currently using Thunderbird
content:
Hello, I'm a Thunderbird user in Japan. I'm sharing my work with my co-worker, therefore, we have received exactly same emails on Thunderbird. And my email data from Outlook grown too big to handle. So, I would like to install my co-worker's email data to my new Thunderbird which has ongoing email data which is slightly different because I don't have the emails which range of date is from around August 20. Also, the range of date of his data is from around September 10. There is approximately roughly 1 month difference.

Therefore, I would like to install his email data. So, I tried to do as below:- My coworker extract "default" data. I changed below to above "default" data. (Above might be slight different, because I did this change on around September 10, so my memory is not sure to correct.) Tool > Account setting > Server Setting > Folder email data are stored Local Folder > Data Import > Import from Thunderbird which was installed separately > Import from "default" profile > Error which cause is unknown

Could you kindly let me know how to install the data to my Thunderbird?

Version of my PC is Windows11 23H2(OS build 22631.4249)

Thunderbird version: 128.3.0esr(64 bit)
creator: k_utaka

title: Cartella compattata
content:
Buongiorno, la mia installazione ha diversi account (info, correggi, createsto), per i quali ho creato altrettante cartelle distinte.

Nella cartella Posta in arrivo di ciascun account c'è una sottocartella (Abbonati).

Recentemente mi capita che non riesco più a visualizzare la sottocartella Abbonati per la l'account Correggi (mentre la vedo per Createsto).

Come posso fare per scompattare la cartella?

Grazie, cordiali saluti. Orazio
creator: orazio.celentano

title: Thunderbird not Rendering E-Mails
content:
Thunderbird does not render most Messages correctly, as shown in the Screenshot of the same Message. Also different Messages fail to render in Different ways. Some don't have any Text, some have a bit Text, others have a lot text, and sometimes the Message Information is shown, and Sometimes it is not.

I am on Thunderbird 128.2.3esr (64-bit) On current NixOS unstable. And I use the Plasma Desktop on Wayland.

title: Finding Deleted messages in Thunderbird
content: It appears as if Thunderbird has changed the layout on emails that are deleted. In the past, I would just enter a name of a sender in the search box, and a list of all inward/outward emails to/from that person would display. Now, there is a box at the top of the screen where you enter the name...all this does is bring up a list of suggestions with an email address...not the emails??? Can anyone help please?
creator: lock3

title: Thunderbird replacing some messages with text block
content:
Hello. I cannot find anything similliar to this in troubleshooting or on forums. Thunderbird started displaying a text block instead of some emails. It starts with loading the mesage longer then ussually and some of new messages are replaced with text that resembles part of encoded email. What's strange is that it is always the same message that replaces the email, looking like in image in the attachement below (it contains a reference to attachement that has been sent previously in some other mail, but in now way connected to email that it replaces). Email is looking perfectly fine in web client, I can even forward it from web to TB and it displays properly in TB. I don't see any pattern as to what kind of email is replaced by the text block. It affects only some emails but restarting computer or TB doesn't help - email that has been downloaded wrong will stay wrong in TB :)

I copy part of the text from this "block". Can't upload the whole .eml cause I'm concerned with what it actually contains (like private client data) ;)

I will be grateful for any hints about the issue. Paying customer here btw ^^

title: SMTP settings revert back to original
content: I recently tried to send an email but the email could not be sent. I called Spectrum to make sure I had the correct server settings and I do. The incoming server is 993 and the outgoing setting is 587. However, when I change my settings to correct the problem and restart Thunderbird the settings return to exactly the way they were before. Incoming is 587 and outgoing is 993. I don't know what changed my settings but I can receive email but I just can't send email. I ran the troubleshooting program and the same thing happens there as well. Does anyone have any idea as to what is going on and how to resolve this issue?
creator: RickMeyer

title: New version
content: Good morning, I had asked a question early on Saturday, but was unavailable the rest of the weekend so just now responding to associate Corey Bryan's answer. I had gotten a message that I am using an unsupported version and they recommend downloading the latest stable version. He said it appears that I'm on the "Release" channel and most likely want to be on the ESR channel. I also mentioned that I am a cave-man when it comes to anything computer and am very skittish about making any changes as I don't how to straighten out any errors that might occur. He asked me where I installed Thunderbird from and the answer is that I don't know. It was an IT guy that did it many years ago. So I guess my questions are, if I've been using this version for years, do I need to or should I update it? If so, if I click on the latest stable version of Thunderbird, will that change anything on my computer, aside from getting the newer version of T-Bird? And will my e-mails in Thunderbird look any different? Thanks very much for the help. Tony

creator: jruzz

title: SMTP outgoing server Hotmail/Outlook, must change every time want to send an e-mail from different account
content:
There is more than one account set up in Thunderbird, for this problem, if I can solve it for two accounts I can likely get it working for the rest as well. Hotmail accounts/Outlook. All of the accounts receive e-mail no problems. The new Oauth2 is set up and working. But when attempting to SEND a message, every time I must manually edit the "account" to use to match whichever account I am sending from. It is crazy, setting the outgoing smtp server 'user name' to use logging in on the outgoing server, just uses the latest one it is set to.

Sometimes if I forget to change it a message will pop up that e-mail can't be sent from whatever the other login is. It is almost like it expects to have a master account that all of the other accounts send e-mail through.

Tried setting up a second 'identity' but that doesn't seem to fix the problem. Why can't the outgoing user account be set for each account independently?
creator: tk21

title: Thunderbird email system won't connect to website where our emails come to
content: Thunderbird won't connect to our webmail at Heart Internet. We can't receive any emails and often can't send them, though sometimes they will send?! It always asks for the password, which it then doesn't accept (though occasionally it will) or it'll ask us to log in, which it should already be logged in. No idea what's going on!
creator: emmahilsdon

title: New Message Count Not Updating on one Newsgroup
content:
I currently subscribe to six newsgroups, all under the same news server. The way things normally work, when there are no new messages for a particular group, the name of the group appears in my list unbolded and in black. When a new message comes into a group, the name changes to blue and bolded and a number appears to the right of the name in a blue circle indicating the number of new messages. When I click on the newsgroup, I can see the new messages because they are bolded, and when I click on the individual unread messages, they change to unbolded. At that point, the name of the newsgroup changes back to black and unbolded and the number goes away. That’s the way it works for five of the six newsgroups on my list.

But recently the sixth newsgroup has been behaving differently. It used to work just like the others, but recently it started doing something different. Again, if there are no messages, the name of the group is in black, unbolded. But for this group only, when a new message comes in, the names of the group changes to blue and bolded but no number appears to the right. This time, when I then click on the newsgroup, no messages are bolded and I have to figure out based on dates and times or my memory of the messages which ones are new. When I click on the new messages (and I'm not sure if it's one or all of the unread), the newsgroup color in the listing changes back to black and unbolded.

At first, I thought this was just some weird one-time thing, but it is now happening every time a new message appears in just that group. I have tried repairing the folder but it does not good. Any idea what's happening?
creator: rwm6
